element.name: Thornton Prison Views by Orangetigerprawn, Traditional Cache (1.5/1.5)
element.description: Views from Thornton Hall over North Co Dublin and Co Meath.
element.long-description:
The cache is located on the northern edge of of Thornton Hall, site of the new prison being built by the Irish Prison Service.
The prison is designed to accommodate approximately 1,400 prisoners, based on single cell occupancy, over a range of facilities all housed behind the 7.2m high security wall. The design has the capacity, if needed in the future, to accommodate up to 2,200 prisoners in multiple occupancy arrangements. This design feature will future proof the prison in capacity terms for at least the next 50 years.
The prison is due to be operational in Mid-Summer 2011.
The newly planted trees in the general area of the cache are to disguise and camouflage the prison wall.

ul.li:
2010-01-31T20:00:00Z : Found it by CluelessTwo
Quick cache n dash TNLNST, TFTC

2009-10-29T19:00:00Z : Found it by shorty.b
found it nice hiding spot

2009-07-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by merann
Quick, easy find. Hardest part was finding somewhere to park. SL. TFTC, Merann.

2009-07-21T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kili or bust
I guess this one had fallen out of its hiding place as it was on the ground. Just lifted it up a foot or two, thanks!
